title: How to Make a Fruits De Mer Pizza

steps.headline: Puree the tomatoes in a blender until smooth.
steps.description: Pour the mixture into a pot.

steps.headline: Heat the tomato sauce to a medium heat.
Meanwhile, crush the oregano and include it in the tomato sauce.
Add a pinch or two of salt in the tomato sauce, taste if it is not too hot.
Optionally, you can add mashed beef in the preparation, to make a kind of Bolognese sauce.
Turn the heat up to medium high, let simmer and go onto the dough preparation step.
Put 500 grams flour in a bowl, add 2 tablespoons olive oil to the flour.
Melt half a stick of butter in a microwave, and put it on the flour and olive oil
Mix a first time.
Add 1 cup of water then mix more.
steps.description: If the pasta becomes too 'thick' add more water, but not too much.

steps.headline: Spread and stretch the dough into a reasonable circle (or heart if you want to make 'fruits de mer pizza du coeur' ), then prepare the topping.
Retrieve the tomato sauce you made and pour it over the dough, and spread it evenly.
Add shredded swiss cheese over it, spread well too.
steps.description: The cheese will be a bit "grilled" when it comes out the oven. Swiss cheese would be perfect for this type of pizza, but you can use any cheese you want of course.

steps.headline: Now, put the mushrooms on top of the cheese.
steps.description: They blend well with the taste of the cheese.

steps.headline: You must choose the taste you want to eventually get by balancing the ingredients your way.
steps.description: You are free to add or remove ingredients from the list above.

steps.headline: Put the mussels (without their shell) on the pizza, then the clams.
steps.description: Then decorate this with the other ingredients, again your way.

steps.headline: Add vegetables that will balance the taste of the pizza.
steps.description: For example, add broccoli to soften the taste of the seafood.

steps.headline: Place the pizza in the oven and cook it at 200°C (400°F) for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let cool for 5-10 minutes.
Enjoy!

text: Tomato Sauce Puree the tomatoes in a blender until smooth. Pour the mixture into a pot. Heat the tomato sauce to a medium heat.  Meanwhile, crush the oregano and include it in the tomato sauce.  Add a pinch or two of salt in the tomato sauce, taste if it is not too hot.  Optionally, you can add mashed beef in the preparation, to make a kind of Bolognese sauce.  Turn the heat up to medium high, let simmer and go onto the dough preparation step.  Dough preparation Put 500 grams flour in a bowl, add 2 tablespoons olive oil to the flour.  Melt half a stick of butter in a microwave, and put it on the flour and olive oil  Mix a first time.  Add 1 cup of water then mix more. If the pasta becomes too 'thick' add more water, but not too much. Spread and stretch the dough into a reasonable circle (or heart if you want to make 'fruits de mer pizza du coeur' ), then prepare the topping.  Adding Toppings Retrieve the tomato sauce you made and pour it over the dough, and spread it evenly.  Add shredded swiss cheese over it, spread well too. The cheese will be a bit "grilled" when it comes out the oven. Swiss cheese would be perfect for this type of pizza, but you can use any cheese you want of course. Now, put the mushrooms on top of the cheese. They blend well with the taste of the cheese. You must choose the taste you want to eventually get by balancing the ingredients your way. You are free to add or remove ingredients from the list above. Put the mussels (without their shell) on the pizza, then the clams. Then decorate this with the other ingredients, again your way. Add vegetables that will balance the taste of the pizza. For example, add broccoli to soften the taste of the seafood. Place the pizza in the oven and cook it at 200°C (400°F) for 20 minutes.  Remove from the oven and let cool for 5-10 minutes. Slice and serve. Enjoy!
